item.title: Vengeance Is a Dish Served Cold
item.description: Vengeance Is a Dish Served Cold, also known as Death's Dealer, is a 1971 Italian Western film directed by Pasquale Squitieri and starring Klaus Kinski.

item.title: I due figli di Ringo
item.description: Two Sons of Ringo is a 1966 Italian western-parody film. It was the last film directed by Giorgio Simonelli who, for health reasons, left the production just before the end of filming and was replaced by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: W Django!
item.description: W Django! is a 1971 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Edoardo Mulargia and starring Anthony Steffen.

item.title: Time of Vultures
item.description: Il tempo degli avvoltoi is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Nando Cicero.

item.title: The Nephews of Zorro
item.description: The Nephews of Zorro is a 1968 Italian comedy film directed by Marcello Ciorciolini.

item.title: Roy Colt and Winchester Jack
item.description: Roy Colt & Winchester Jack is a 1970 Spaghetti Western film directed by Mario Bava.

item.title: Son of Django
item.description: Son of Django is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Osvaldo Civirani.

item.title: Drei Amen für den Satan
item.description: Drei Amen für den Satan ist ein Italowestern von Pasquale Squitieri aus dem Jahr 1971. Die deutschsprachige Erstaufführung geschah am 23. Juni 1972.

item.title: I due figli di Ringo
item.description: I due figli di Ringo ist eine im deutschen Sprachraum nicht gezeigte Italowestern-Parodie, die 1966 von Giorgio Simonelli inszeniert wurde.

item.title: Ein Fressen für Django
item.description: Ein Fressen für Django ist ein Italowestern von Edoardo Mulargia, der im deutschsprachigen Raum um 12 Minuten gekürzt am 15. September 1972 erstaufgeführt wurde.
